review: Ok, I had even more troubles with spooling and connections, cross tested, and it definitely has more connectivity and spooling issues than my Roku2, so I returned it. I'm so glad to be rid of it!!!It just does not seem as stable as my other ROKU, a Roku2 when tested on the same unit at the same location. It spools more and loads slowly, I wish I would have gone a different direction. Phone support is ok, but the online chat SUCKS... it's like saying one sentence and then being on hold for a few minutes while the tech deals with too many multiple users.

review: I got this for my dad as he has a smaller conventional LCD TV on a wall mount with an electrical outlet behind the set. It has a great picture and no wires or cables are visible. Roku has added a bunch of free channels that have a lot of the older programming that he likes as well as all of the popular channels such as Hulu Plus and Netflix.Just a note that this works good up to 720P. If you have a large screen that supports a higher resolution you might want to go with a larger Roku however 720P looks pretty good on everything at and below a 32."
